page.title: 04Churches.
page.content: There are three churches in the area, although two are no longer used as such. One is now the Atlantis Gallery and the other the Red Cross Hall, both being situated in the High Street. The main Parish Church, however, is St. Mary's, and the earliest part dates from 1350 and is the tower on the north aisle. The nave and the west tower were built in 1449, and the tower has six bells, the oldest of which is dated 1528. The Jacobean screen was built in 1620. Possibly the finest part of the building is the chancel, which was built by Sir Charles Berkeley in 1743. The church is twinned with that in Williamsburg, in America, which bears the same name and dates from the time when Sir William Berkeley was Governor of Virginia. Recently, a new graveyard was opened at Cuckoo Hill.
